description: a(n) is the largest integer m such that m is divisible by every integer in the interval 1 <= x <= m^(1/n).
comments: Probably this is a subsequence of A003418 but I do not have a proof at the moment.
example: a(3) = 420 because 420^(1/3) = 7.4888..., 420 is divisible by all of 1,2,3,4,5,6,7 and it is the largest such number with respect to the exponent 1/3.
author: Ahmed Fares (ahmedfares(AT)my-deja.com), May 07 2001
